ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Verant priorities again
ygData.msgSnippet: Sylly, my twin, I sense much anger from you....... err and sarcasm, and well, you get my drift..... Tell me what you really think sis. Jaezebel Moonsong Spirit
ygData.messageBody:
Sylly, my twin, I sense much anger from you....... err and sarcasm, and
well, you get my drift..... Tell me what you really think sis.

Jaezebel Moonsong
Spirit of the Moon
Innoruuk

-----Original Message-----
From: Sylly Songsynger <jgs@...>
To: eqbards@egroups.com <eqbards@egroups.com>
Date: Friday, June 02, 2000 9:24 AM
Subject: [eqbards] Verant priorities again


>Clipped from a web site:
>
>[Quote from original post: Tonight, as my group and I were on our way to
Dalnir, we decided to take a short cut through Cabilis. So we invised
ourselves and strolled past the guards. I was killed lickity-split, while my
pals weren't. Wondering why the guards saw through my invis and not the
others, we tried a few experiments to find out. Well we found the answer.
>
>Seems if you invis or camo yourself, then someone else tries to overwrite
your invis with one of their own, you are now visible, though the icon
remains.
>
>This brings up all sorts of issues (intentional PKing?). I'd like to know
if Verant is aware of this bug or not?]
>
>This is a bug that we are aware of. If anyone casts a buff of any kind on
you while you are invis, you are then visible to NPCs even though the icon
remains.
>
>Thank you for bringing it up though, I'll see if I can find out where it is
on the to-do list.
>
>End clip.
>
>In the meantime, don't try grouping with 7 of your fiends - you dirty
rotten no good exploiters!!! We have guides posted everywhere who will ban
you without recourse! They have been given strict instructions to stop
helping people who die zoning - sorry but some of you are just gonna fall
thru the cracks - literally - while we bring you vicious exploiters to
justice! And if I remember, and happen to see someone at the water cooler,
I'll ask him to ask around and see if anyone feels like fixing your
invisibility bug.
>
>Sylly
>
>
>
>
>[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
